channel.title: New board [untrustable users]
channel.description:
Dear Mpsc community
I had an idea, there should be a new board, so we can post people scamming or lying. We should get this to beware people for those 'untrusted' people so we get less scamming. For example Oblivion2, got leaked, its nothing to be scared as its un-updated and it had an antileech but, we tried to post proof, and we couldn't. i hope a board for this is created.
Regards, Stan

item.title: New board [untrustable users]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:25, topic:481630”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=599868.msg4214360#msg4214360 date=1360017115]

  1. Report a moderator system
  2. Contact a staff member through the PM system
  3. Contact a staff member through the IRC

3 perfectly good substitutes for reporting people
[/quote]

Basically this, creating a board for this is just overkill.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: New board [untrustable users]
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Explain to me how you would "see" a banned user. When you say through Skype conversations, simply take a screenshot, and show plausible evidence that this user is untrustworthy. There might not be much a moderator can do, simply because it is your fault in the first place for not researching the applying member. To avoid this, just use a very descriptive application format that allows you to be informed about who and what kind of person the applier is.
We did this, and it got deleted, "We shouldn't point others directly". We have proof.

Read full topic

item.title: New board [untrustable users]
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:19, topic:481630”]1) Report a moderator system
2) Contact a staff member through the PM system
3) Contact a staff member through the IRC

3 perfectly good substitutes for reporting people[/quote]

Basically this, creating a board for this is just overkill.

Read full topic

item.title: New board [untrustable users]
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

At everyone who agrees with this suggestion:

Everybody is equal, don't treat people worse than you do others(E.G., don't isolate someone and flame them).
We respect each other and other communities. We do not flame. There is to be no fighting on the forums.
You are able to deal with "untrustable" users through a private message with any MoparScape staff and/or the "Report user" feature. There is absolutely no need to derail other members and annihilate any chance they have to redeem themselves.

[quote=“luna-scape, post:9, topic:481630”][quote author=Flame_ link=topic=599868.msg4214301#msg4214301 date=1360013311]
So…this is just making a board to replace the “Report to a Moderator” option? Why derail other members when the rules specifically states not to do that?
[/quote]
Thats true but I never get why sites as rune-server has a community that is banned for 50% and on mopar i almost never see a banned user. Thats because we are just awesome people or that players don’t know what to do when they are scammed.
And I am talking about skype conversations not a post some where. I just thought to make this board so people know who is trusted and who is not.[/quote]

Explain to me how you would “see” a banned user. When you say through Skype conversations, simply take a screenshot, and show plausible evidence that this user is untrustworthy. There might not be much a moderator can do, simply because it is your fault in the first place for not researching the applying member. To avoid this, just use a very descriptive application format that allows you to be informed about who and what kind of person the applier is.

Read full topic

item.title: New board [untrustable users]
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:13, topic:481630”][quote author=luna-scape link=topic=599868.msg4214309#msg4214309 date=1360013732]

So…this is just making a board to replace the “Report to a Moderator” option? Why derail other members when the rules specifically states not to do that?
[/quote]Nope its not to replace “Report to a Mod…” it’s so people can see if somone is not trusted, they can check up in that board and see if there’s anything bad about him, if he has leaked or tried to steal anything…
well thats what i understand.

That is why we used to have rep, but with this, like rep, it can be manipulated. People may use the board to their own advantage to get pay back at someone they do not like, it wouldn’t work.

They have to show prove ofcourse.

Anyone can make up their own proof, there is such a program as photoshop and with skype accounts you can change your name to make it appear as someone elses.[/quote]if somone would leak your source he would release it/sell it and everybody would notice, so photoshop manipulating wouldn’t be a problem…

Read full topic

That is why we used to have rep, but with this, like rep, it can be manipulated. People may use the board to their own advantage to get pay back at someone they do not like, it wouldn’t work.

They have to show prove ofcourse.[/quote]
Anyone can make up their own proof, there is such a program as photoshop and with skype accounts you can change your name to make it appear as someone elses.
